question: Question_A_18
statement:
Find the matrix for the linear transformation
$S : \mathbb{R}^{3} \to \mathbb{R}^{3}$ given by

\[S\left( \begin{bmatrix} x \\ y \\ z \end{bmatrix} \right) = \begin{bmatrix} -y + z \\ x + y + z \\ -x - 2y \end{bmatrix}\]
hints:
Split the vector on the right into a sum of three vectors, separated by
\emph{x}, \emph{y}, \emph{z}, then take the vectors as the columns of
your matrix \emph{S}.
